  title="Navigation/List/List"
  component={ List }
/>

<!--- Component template -->

export const listTemplate = args => {
  const onClick = useCallback(() => alert('On click!'), []);
  return (
    <List {...args}>
      <ListItem onClick={onClick}>
        Board Power up
      </ListItem>
      <ListItem oonClick={onClick}>
        Team Power up
      </ListItem>
      <ListItem onClick={onClick}>
        Essentials
      </ListItem>
    </List>);
};

<!--- Component documentation -->

# List
- [Overview](#overview)
- [Props](#props)

## Overview
Lists is a group of actionable items containing primary and supplemental actions, which are represented by icons and text.

<Canvas>
  <Story name="Overview"
         args={{}}>
    { listTemplate.bind({}) }
  </Story>
</Canvas>

## Props
<ArgsTable of={ List } />

## Usage
<UsageGuidelines guidelines={[
  "Use list component for display a list of navigable items in a column.",
  "List purpose is usually allowing navigation in context to the navigable  content.",
  "Your list items can be either in regular, selected or disabled state. You can control a list item's component state by its attributes.",
]}/>

<Tip title="Check yourself">
  For implementing a menu inside a dialog, please use our
  <Link href="/?path=/docs/navigation-menu--overview" size={Link.sizes.SMALL}>Menu</Link>
  component
</Tip>

### List with virtualization optimization

When you display a large number of items, you may want to render only the options shown at a given moment to allow better performance and a
better user experience.
<Canvas>

    While using virtualization optimization on your list component, please be aware your list needs to contain a constant height and width
    for function properly
</Tip>

## Do’s and Don’ts
<ComponentRules
  rules={[
    {
      positive: {
        component: <div className={classes["leftpane-workspaces-section"]}>
          <List>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Add}/>
              Add
            </ListItem>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Filter} />
              Filter
            </ListItem>
          </List>
          <Divider/>
          <List>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Board} />
              Board name
            </ListItem>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Board} />
              Board name
            </ListItem>
          </List>
        </div>,
        description:"Use a list component to create a menu displayed on one of the various sections of your web page."
      },
      negative: {
        component:<DialogContentContainer>
          <List>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Add}/>
              Add
            </ListItem>
            <ListItem>
              <ListItemIcon icon={Filter} />
              Filter
            </ListItem>
          </List>
          <Divider />
          <List>
          <ListItem>
            <ListItemIcon icon={Board} />
            Board name
          </ListItem>
          <ListItem>
            <ListItemIcon icon={Board} />
            Board name
          </ListItem>
        </List></DialogContentContainer>,
        description:<>
          Do not use the list to implement a menu displayed inside a dialog. See <Link href="/?path=/docs/navigation-menu--overview" withoutSpacing>Menu</Link>.
        </>
      }
    }
  ]}
/>
